alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 19 at 2:25PM AKST until February 21 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible. Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Total snow accumulations of up to two inches are possible. * WHERE...Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley. * WHEN...From Sunday evening through Monday afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...East winds gusting as high as 55 mph could cause whiteout conditions in blowing snow. Significant drifting of the snow is also possible. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Watch for blizzard conditions means there is a potential for falling and/or blowing snow with strong winds and extremely poor visibilities. This can lead to whiteout conditions and make travel very difficult.
